creditline: Gift of Elizabeth, Julie, and Catherine Andrus in memory of John and Marion Andrus
description: seated female nude, with legs tucked up, reaching PR arm up to stroke the neck of a large swan to her L; portion of a tree in background, and castle ULQ background
inscription:
Signature, Date, Inscription

-- inscribed in plate at lower left: [LEDA A IOVE, IN CYGNVM / VERSO, COMPRESSA.]
-- in graphite on verso: B112
provenance: John E. Andrus III, Wayzata, Minn.; by descent to his daughters, Elizabeth, Katie, and Julie. Earlier provenances have been gathered, but further research will increase our knowledge of their histories.
signed: monogram and date in plate, upper left: [1548 / HSB]
title: Leda and the Swan
